title: Storm-Chaser Mobile Lab Adventure #35
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Main Laboratory
rooms.description: The interior of a high-tech mobile storm-chasing laboratory. Computer monitors display swirling radar images of a massive supercell. The vehicle rocks slightly as wind buffets the exterior. Equipment racks line the walls, and warning lights flash amber. Through reinforced windows, you see dark clouds and lightning. The air smells of ozone and electronics.

items.name: meteorological workstation
items.description: A bank of computers displaying real-time weather data and storm tracking information
items.text: STORM ALERT: Category 5 supercell detected. Wind speed: 180 mph. Mission Commander: Dr. Sarah Torres. Lead Meteorologist: Dr. James Chen. Vehicle commissioned: 2019. WARNING: Immediate evacuation recommended.

items.name: equipment storage rack
items.description: A metal rack holding various meteorological instruments and emergency supplies

items.name: mission log tablet
items.description: A digital tablet with the current mission's log entries
items.text: Mission Log - Day 12: Dr. Torres has taken us closer than ever to the storm core. The data we're collecting is unprecedented. Emergency protocols stored in the secure cabinet. Access code is the year this lab was commissioned: 2019.

items.name: secure equipment cabinet
items.description: A locked metal cabinet with a four-digit combination lock and emergency protocol labels

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'DATA CENTER ACCESS - AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY'

items.name: emergency procedures manual
items.description: A red binder containing evacuation protocols
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In case of extreme weather danger, proceed to the data center to secure critical research. Then access the emergency escape pod. Commander authorization required for pod deployment.

items.name: supply locker
items.description: A tall locker containing safety equipment and supplies

items.name: emergency weather radio
items.description: A handheld radio receiving severe weather alerts
items.text: ALERT: Tornado warning in effect. Multiple vortices detected. All storm-chaser units advised to evacuate immediately. Seek shelter in reinforced structures.

items.name: reinforced door to data center
items.description: A heavy steel door with a card reader, leading to the data storage and analysis center

rooms.name: Data Center
rooms.description: A cramped room filled with server racks and data storage systems. Cooling fans whir loudly. Multiple screens display atmospheric pressure readings, wind vectors, and 3D storm models. The vehicle shudders as hail pounds the exterior. Red emergency lights pulse rhythmically. A sealed hatch leads to the escape pod bay.

items.name: main server rack
items.description: A tall rack of servers storing years of storm research data
items.text: SERVER STATUS: All critical data backed up. Research archive contains 5 years of storm data collected by Dr. Torres and Dr. Chen. Location: Mobile Lab operates in Tornado Alley region.

items.name: data analysis terminal
items.description: A computer terminal displaying complex atmospheric models
items.text: CURRENT ANALYSIS: Storm system shows unprecedented rotation. Dr. Chen's algorithms predict F5 tornado formation imminent. Recommend immediate evacuation to escape pod. Dr. Torres must authorize deployment.

items.name: research desk
items.description: A desk covered with printouts, charts, and a locked drawer

items.name: escape pod activation key
items.description: A specialized key required to activate the emergency escape pod

items.name: storm classification chart
items.description: A laminated chart showing tornado and wind speed classifications
items.text: FUJITA SCALE: F0 (40-72 mph), F1 (73-112 mph), F2 (113-157 mph), F3 (158-206 mph), F4 (207-260 mph), F5 (261-318 mph). Current storm: 180 mph sustained winds - F3 classification.

items.name: filing cabinet
items.description: A cabinet containing research papers and personnel files

items.name: personnel records
items.description: Files on the storm-chasing team members
items.text: TEAM ROSTER: Dr. Sarah Torres - Mission Commander, Storm Dynamics Specialist. Dr. James Chen - Lead Meteorologist, Data Analysis. The team operates in Tornado Alley, the most active severe weather region in North America.

items.name: escape pod access hatch
items.description: A circular hatch with a security panel displaying three verification questions. Warning lights flash around its perimeter.

password_questions.question: Who is the mission commander?
password_questions.hint: Check the workstation display and personnel records

password_questions.question: What region does the lab operate in?
password_questions.hint: The server rack and personnel file mention the operating region

password_questions.question: What is the current wind speed in mph?
password_questions.hint: Check the storm alert on the workstation and the classification chart

rooms.name: Emergency Escape Pod Bay
rooms.description: You've reached the escape pod! A reinforced capsule sits in its launch cradle, designed to withstand extreme weather. Through a small porthole, you see the massive tornado bearing down on your position. The pod's systems glow green, ready for immediate deployment. A countdown timer shows you have seconds to launch.

items.name: emergency escape pod
items.description: A heavily armored capsule with independent power and life support systems

items.name: pod launch console
items.description: The control panel for escape pod deployment, all systems showing green status lights

items.name: reinforced porthole
items.description: A small window showing the approaching tornado
items.text: Through the porthole, you see the massive funnel cloud, debris swirling in its vortex. Lightning flashes illuminate the dark wall cloud. You need to launch NOW!

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You activate the escape pod and strap in as the launch sequence initiates. The pod rockets away from the mobile lab just as the tornado engulfs it. Through the porthole, you watch the lab tumble through the air, but you're safe in the reinforced capsule. The pod's parachute deploys, and you drift to a safe landing miles away. You've survived the storm and escaped with your life! You win!
